revised_title: On the Absorption of Polarized Light by Doubly Refracting Crystals
tldr: David Brewster examines the absorption of polarized light by doubly refracting crystals, discovering that the coloration of these crystals is related to the arrangement of their particles and the axes of double refraction. He also notes that the coloration of the ordinary and extraordinary mediums can vary within the same mineral, and that heat can change the color of topaz by discharging certain color particles.
